verse.roman:
dattvācamanam uccheṣaṁ
viṣvakṣenāya kalpayet
mukha-vāsaṁ surabhimat
tāmbūlādyam athārhayet

synonyms: dattvā—offering; ācamanam—water for washing the Lord's mouth; uccheṣam—the remnants of His food; viṣvaksenāya—to the personal associate of Lord Viṣṇu, Viṣvaksena; kalpayet—one should give; mukha-vāsam—cologne for the mouth; surabhi-mat—fragrant; tāmbūla-ādyam—betel-nut preparation; atha—then; arhayet—one should present.
translation: Once again he should offer the Deity water for washing His mouth, and he should give the remnants of the Lord's food to Viṣvaksena. Then he should present the Deity with fragrant perfume for the mouth and prepared betel nut.
